title: Cyrus the Great
summary: Cyrus II of Persia (c. 600 – 530 BC; Old Persian: 𐎤𐎢𐎽𐎢𐏁, romanized: Kūruš;[4][5] New Persian: کوروش‎, romanized: Kūroš),[6] commonly known as Cyrus the Great,[7] and also called Cyrus the Elder by the Greeks, was the founder of the Achaemenid Empire, the first Persian empire.[8]
